title: Bang Mo Volcano
description: Located on the 'Symphony of New Winds' tourist route, Bang Mo Volcano is a geological experience, where visitors can explore the timeless marks of Earth's geological history on this M'nông plateau.|||Bang Mo Volcano (formerly known as Ea T'Linh Volcano) is situated in Ea T'Linh town, Cư Jút district. It is a young volcano, typical of central eruption type, dating back 200,000 to 600,000 years.|||The Bang Mo Volcano crater is well-preserved with a relatively round shape; approximately 242m in diameter, 40m high, with a 15-degree slope, and at an elevation of 407m above sea level. The surrounding area features scattered volcanic ash, rocks, and bombs.|||From the base of the volcano, it takes about 30 minutes to climb to the crater. The gentle slope makes it suitable for visitors of all ages. From the resting point at the summit, the panoramic view of Ea T'Linh town's peaceful and prosperous landscape is breathtaking. Bang Mo Volcano promises to be a fascinating and unique destination for travelers.

title: Thác đá Granite
description: Trong khi tỉnh Đắk Nông được bao phủ chủ yếu bởi đất, đá trầm tích (được hình thành trong môi trường đại dương) và đất, đá bazan (hình thành khi xuất hiện hoạt động của núi lửa) thì tại Vườn Quốc gia Tà Đùng lại sở hữu những khối đá xâm nhập granite, thể hiện một quá trình hoạt động địa chất rất đa dạng và phức tạp của Công viên địa chất toàn cầu UNESCO Đắk Nông.|||Đá granite là loại đá sáng màu có nguồn gốc từ nham thạch với các hạt đủ lớn để nhìn thấy bằng mắt thường. Loại đá này được hình thành từ quá trình kết tinh chậm dung nham dưới bề mặt trái đất. Đá granite chủ yếu được cấu tạo bằng thạnh anh và felspat với một lượng nhỏ mica, khoáng vật silicat và các khoáng vật khác.|||Rất ít người biết rằng, cũng tại nơi đây, có một thác nước rất đặc biệt và độc đáo với dòng chảy bao phủ lên những khối đá granite, được các nhà khoa học đặt tên là Thác đá granite. Trong khi đó, người dân địa phương thường gọi thác nước này là thác “Trượt” vì độ trơn nhẵn và sáng bóng của các khối đá trong lòng thác. Hiện có rất ít Công viên địa chất toàn cầu UNESCO trên thế giới sở hữu loại thác đá granite tương tự.|||Thác đá granite nằm ẩn mình trong khu rừng già tại xã Đắk Som, huyện Đắk G’long. Từ Quốc lộ 28, để đến được thác, cần đi bộ khoảng 1 km theo hướng bảng chỉ dẫn của Công viên địa chất toàn cầu UNESCO Đắk Nông. Dọc tuyến đi bộ này, du khách có cơ hội được tận hưởng không khí mát mẻ, trong lành và ngắm nhìn cảnh quang thiên nhiên hoang sơ, tươi đẹp dọc hai bên đường. Điểm tham quan thác cũng đã được huyện đầu tư xây dựng chòi ngắm cảnh để quan sát toàn cảnh vẻ đẹp thơ mộng của khu vực thác đá granite.|||Tuy là một thác nước nhỏ nhưng nơi đây lại là địa điểm linh thiêng, nơi diễn ra các hoạt động sinh hoạt cộng đồng của người dân địa phương, như các buổi lễ cúng thần linh của người đồng bào dân tộc Mạ từ bao đời nay để cầu cho mưa thuận gió hòa, mùa màng tốt tươi.|||Là một điểm tham quan trên tuyến Âm vang từ Trái đất, thác nước granite thơ mộng nổi bật trên quang cảnh thiên nhiên hùng vĩ của núi rừng Tà Đùng chắc chắn là một điểm đến hấp dẫn, không thể bỏ qua đối với những du khách ưu khám phá, mạo hiểm.

title: Chợ nổi Trà Ôn
description: Nếu muốn tìm hiểu đặc sắc văn hóa sinh hoạt của người dân Vĩnh Long, hãy đến chợ nổi Trà Ôn. Cách vàm Trà Ôn 250m, chợ nổi ở hạ lưu sông Hậu có chiều dài trên 300m, thường họp theo con nước nên nước lớn thì chợ đông.|||Chợ nổi Trà Ôn mang tính chất của một chợ đầu mối phân phối nông sản cho nhiều chợ nhỏ khác trong tỉnh. Bởi vậy nên dù ghé chợ trong ngày vào bất kì thời điểm nào trong ngày cũng thấy tấp nập những thuyền ghe.|||Điểm xuyết trong vô số thuyền chở cây trái đủ màu sắc là những ghe bán hoa kiểng trang trí nhiều màu, tạo nên những khoảnh khắc rất “tình” trong nhịp điệu buôn bán sôi nổi.

title: Long An Ancient Pagoda
description: Long An Ancient Pagoda, built in the late 19th century by the devout Lam family, who donated 30 acres of land to construct the pagoda and its surrounding fields. For centuries, it has been a resting place for renowned Buddhist monks from the southern region, including Khanh Anh, Hue Quang, Khanh Hoa, and Phap Hai, who established the Academic Association to promote the correct teachings of Buddhism and spread national language education.|||Upon entering Long An Ancient Pagoda, monks, Buddhists, and visitors feel as though they have entered a serene and happy haven, where chanting helps people escape worldly worries.

title: Hoang Hao Eco-Tourism Area
description: For those seeking a peaceful retreat to the countryside, surrounded by fresh air and savory local dishes, Hoang Hao Eco-Tourism Area is an ideal choice.|||Located on National Route 57, 2 km from Dinh Khao ferry, Hoang Hao ecotourism area is in Thanh Duc commune, Long Ho district, Vinh Long province. Hoang Hao is a brand-new, stunning ecotourism destination in Vinh Long, boasting not only lush green landscapes but also incredibly fresh air.|||Despite opening in 2019, it has quickly become an ideal spot for entertainment, leisure, and relaxation for people of all backgrounds in Vĩnh Long and tourists visiting the Mekong Delta region.|||The entire campus of Hoàng Hảo is surrounded by a vast green forest, giving the impression of a secluded oasis deep in the woods when viewed from above. Visiting Hoàng Hảo allows you to fully immerse in the serene and peaceful atmosphere of the Western river region.|||The space at Hoang Hao tourist area is designed with a rich Mekong Delta (Miền Tây) garden style, featuring small streams resembling mini rivers that flow throughout the entire area. The two banks are connected by unique and exciting monkey bridges.||||||Covering an area of nearly 68 hectares, Hoang Hao Vĩnh Long Ecotourism offers a wide range of exciting entertainment services suitable for both adults and children.|||At Hoang Hao ecological tourist site, visitors can immerse themselves in the pristine natural scenery and participate in rustic activities like fishing, rowing, catching fish in the ditch, catching ducks, and catching frogs. For the adventurous, there's the thrill of cycling across wooden bridges or crossing monkey bridges and enjoying many other games in the complex playground.|||Two popular games that tourists love at the resort village are Zorbing – where a large ball rolls down a gentle grassy slope and a colorful water ball rolling game.|||With its large area and open space, the Hoàng Hảo (Royal Gem) eco-tourism site is also an ideal location for team building, camping, picnics, outdoor activities, and experiential learning.|||Hoang Hao also features a mini house area for overnight stays, catering to the needs of tourists. The mini houses are thatched with straw roofs or tin roofs, and their lower parts are adorned with vibrant, brightly colored walls.|||In front of the mini house row lies a vast lotus pond. The lake is covered with lotus plants, and when the lotus flowers bloom, the area is enveloped in a soft pink hue and a sweet fragrance, creating a romantic atmosphere.|||After a day of outdoor games at Hoàng Hảo, you can unwind in a mini house within the resort, surrounded by nature. Each morning, wake up to fresh air, watch lotus flowers bloom, and listen to birds singing in the distance. It's a truly idyllic life, harmonious with nature.|||When visiting the Hoang Hao tourist area, don't forget to stop by the super-wide restaurant located within the Hoang Hao eco-tourism complex to savor the distinctive dishes of the Western Region.|||The space here is incredibly airy thanks to its harmonious design with nature. You can try signature dishes like grilled chicken rice, savory pancakes, southern fermented fish hotpot, crispy fried catfish, pickled lotus stem, and lotus stem cake, all of which boast the irresistible flavor of the riverine region that will leave you craving for more after just one try. Especially, adventurous travelers will delight in thrilling moments, feeling refreshed as they watch catfish jumping out of the water to catch bait, and can even try their hand at making traditional southern cakes like savory pancakes, mini savory pancakes, or leaf-wrapped cakes.

title: Vinh Sang Tourist Area
description: Looking for a group entertainment spot in Vinh Long, many would point you to Vinh Sang eco-tourism area. Vinh Sang Farm is triangular in shape, with a prime location along the Co Chien River, opposite Vinh Long City.|||Perhaps nowhere else offers the chance to see as many rare animals as this tourist area, including bears, goats, egrets, snakes, monitor lizards, deer, pigs, pink-cheeked monkeys, macaques, peacocks, and more. The 200m2 crocodile farm at Vinh Sang is a haven for thrill-seekers.|||Despite its unique features, the area still feels cozy and intimate, like a traditional Southern Vietnamese garden. The spacious and airy environment is perfect for lively activities like grass sliding, shooting, cockfighting, ball throwing, blindfolded ostrich feather sticking, and fishing competitions. For those who prefer a quieter experience, individual travelers can enjoy the peaceful atmosphere in the fishing huts.|||The entrance fee to Vinh Sang Tourist Area is very reasonable: 50,000 VND for adults and 35,000 VND for children (from 5 to 11 years old or under 1.2m tall). If you buy a tour ticket on Fridays, you'll get free access to crocodile fishing, ostrich riding, and duck pedaling.

title: Ancient House Eco-Area
description: The Ancient House Eco-Area is a Vĩnh Long tourist destination that evokes the strongest sense of nostalgia in visitors. It's called an eco-area because, aside from the aged house, it's surrounded by ornamental trees and fruit gardens that create a harmonious, green atmosphere.|||Even those unfamiliar with architecture can't help but marvel at the intricate carvings of birds, flowers, and other motifs. The entire ancient house is made of precious wood and has a history that spans more years than the combined ages of a group of tourists.

title: Bung Binh Thien
description: Bung Binh Thien is a serene lake with crystal-clear waters, offering a picturesque landscape in An Giang perfect for camping, picnics, and fishing. Visitors can take a leisurely boat ride around the lake, and there are fishing huts and eateries to stop and relax. This is an ideal rustic getaway in An Giang for couples looking for a romantic escape.

title: Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai
description: One of the unmentioned attractions is that Ben Tre also draws visitors with Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai. This spot still boasts its pristine beauty with a stretch of white sand and rows of green trees swaying gently in the breeze. Certainly, visiting this place will give tourists wonderful and exciting experiences.|||Thua Duc Beach is known for its peaceful and serene atmosphere, with its pristine beauty and rows of palm trees shading the road. The sound of waves and the gentle rustling of the wind create a symphony of sounds that are hard to resist.|||Thua Duc Beach is a natural beach located in Binh Dai District, Ben Tre Province. It stretches about 8km long and is over 60 km from Ben Tre City. This place has a cool and fresh climate, attracting many tourists to visit each year.|||Thua Duc Beach is a beach with pristine and attractive beauty. The sea water has waves rolling in, and the shore is lined with fine, long sand. The sounds of the wind, trees, and waves all blend together in a harmonious melody of Thua Duc. A gentle and enticing tune that draws in tourists.|||The area has a cool and fresh climate, making it ideal for visiting and relaxing. Each year, over 12,000 tourists visit, and Ben Tre Province is working to develop Thua Duc Beach into a prominent tourist destination, aiming to attract 50,000 to 70,000 visitors annually.|||Not only is the place beautiful and attractive, but it is also a rich area for seafood like clams, mussels, snails, and crabs. Furthermore, it is famous for its delicious banh xeo. Perhaps, only by visiting can tourists fully appreciate the taste of the seafood and the rich flavor of banh xeo, a local specialty.|||The unique taste of the local cuisine is a special thing that leaves an impression on tourists visiting Thua Duc. By coming to this beautiful and poetic beach, tourists can visit, swim, rest, relax, and enjoy the local food culture with many delicious dishes.|||Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai promises to bring the most exciting experiences to tourists. This place is also being invested in and developed, so it will certainly become a wonderful destination for tourists in the future.

title: Orchid King Tourist Area
description: Just 5km from the center of Ben Tre city, the Orchid King Tourist Area is an ideal destination for relaxation and entertainment, chosen by many. Visitors can immerse themselves in the cool natural surroundings and enjoy fun activities like rope bridges, zip lines, and monkey bridges.|||In addition to exciting games, the Orchid King Tourist Area also offers a range of tourism services, including restaurants, farmstays, camping, and more. If you're looking for a great spot in Ben Tre to have fun with family and friends, the Orchid King Tourist Area is an excellent choice.

title: Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village
description: Getting to the Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village is straightforward. Starting from Saigon, simply cross Rạch Miễu Bridge, turn left for about 700m to Cá Chuối Bridge. Once you've crossed this bridge, you'll have arrived at this famous eco-tourism site.|||Visitors to the Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village will undoubtedly be thrilled and delighted by the authentic Southern Vietnamese natural scenery and unique organizational style. This destination truly deserves to be one of the most impressive tourist spots in the Western region, leaving an unforgettable impression on visitors.|||One of the exciting experiences here is dressing up in traditional Southern Vietnamese attire, known as bà ba. You can also participate in various folk games like monkey bridge crossing, coconut tree climbing, balance bike riding, fish catching, and rope crossing.|||Additionally, you can try your hand at making clay firecrackers or cooking traditional garden dishes with your friends, which promises to be an extremely exciting and appealing experience.|||Upon arriving at the Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village, you'll be impressed by the picturesque and romantic natural scenery of the riverine countryside. A special highlight of this place is the traditional floating villages of the local people. The atmosphere is serene and peaceful, making anyone who visits feel light and carefree, shedding all worries of daily life.|||Try sitting on a small boat, drifting along the winding rivers, or letting your spirit roam free with the water of the Western region, savoring the fresh and enticing fruits. These will be wonderful moments that you won't want to forget for a single second.

title: Phu Da Sandbar
description: Located about 100km from Ho Chi Minh City, Phu Da Sandbar is an ideal destination for city dwellers to explore on weekends. If traveling by motorbike, follow this route: Start from Ho Chi Minh City, head towards the Western region on National Highway 1A, then cross My Thuan Bridge and continue on National Highway 53, and finally take the Pham Hung road to An Binh ferry terminal. From there, take a boat to Phu Da Sandbar.|||Phu Da Sandbar is an eco-tourism destination with a romantic and serene natural landscape, featuring Phu Da Temple, a spiritual site for the locals. Be sure to try the specialty of Phu Da Sandbar – Phu Da snail.|||Phu Da snails are sold in markets all over the sandbar|||According to Mr. Ba Ngoi, a local, Phu Da snails are at their best around May in the Lunar Calendar, with a sweet and rich flavor. After being caught, they are prepared into various dishes like stir-fried snails with lemongrass and chili, boiled snails, or used as an ingredient in salads and pancakes. In Phu Da Sandbar, snails are sold in all markets, and visitors can find them at affordable prices.|||After enjoying the specialty snails, visitors can continue their journey by engaging in activities like rowing, fishing, and exploring the lush orchards. Next, they should visit Phu Da Temple to pray for peace and prosperity and explore the famous Miếu Bà Chúa Xứ temple, known for its miraculous granting of wishes.|||And experience a boat trip to explore the sandbar|||In Ben Tre, aside from Phu Da Sandbar, visitors can also explore Phung Sandbar, Tien Sandbar, or Thoi Son Islet to discover the unique beauty of the Western region.

title: Tua Hai Historical and Cultural Victory Site
description: Located in Tua Hai hamlet, Dong Khoi commune, Chau Thanh district, Tay Ninh province, on highway 22B, 7km northwest of Tay Ninh city.|||Tua Hai was the name of a French watchtower, later expanded by the US and puppet government into a major military base. By 1960, it served as a reserve arms depot for all three tactical zones of the enemy. The site included the 32nd Battalion of the 13th Division, a special forces training school, a rapid response battalion, and two reconnaissance companies embedded among the locals.|||On the night of January 25, 1960, the people and armed forces of Tay Ninh, along with other secret forces from the region, launched a surprise attack on the enemy's headquarters at Tua Hai. This battle marked the beginning of the armed Dong Khoi movement across South Vietnam.|||The site was recognized by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) as the Tua Hai Historical Victory Site in Decision 937/QD-BT on September 23, 1993.|||

title: Long Dien Son Tourist Area
description: Located about 5km from the center of Tay Ninh City and 3km from Nui Ba Den (Black Lady Mountain) Tourist Area, Long Dien Son is a must-visit destination when visiting Tay Ninh. The area stands out with its vast, open space and picturesque landscape, along with a water park offering many exciting games for those traveling with friends and family to relax.|||Long Dien Son Water Park covers an area of over 2 hectares and is currently the largest and only water park in Tay Ninh Province. When visiting, you can try thrilling games like water slides, artificial wave pools,... or areas dedicated to children for family trips.

title: Ma Thien Lanh Tourist Area
description: Located in Thanh Tan commune, Tay Ninh town, Ma Thien Lanh is formed by three mountains: Ba Den Mountain, Heo Mountain, and Phung Mountain.|||The area features hundreds of hectares of pristine forest and streams that flow gently, creating a mystical, wild, and dreamy atmosphere.|||To reach this tourist area, you'll travel on a paved road over 3km from provincial road 785 to Phung Mountain and then to Ma Thien Lanh. However, as its name suggests, the road is quite steep and treacherous. Therefore, before heading out, make sure to prepare thoroughly, both physically and mentally, to ensure a safe journey to Ma Thien Lanh.|||After overcoming the challenging road, Ma Thien Lanh will reward your efforts, allowing you to immerse yourself in the pristine, breathtaking, and peaceful scenery of the area, which remains largely untouched by human hands.

title: Sala Entertainment Complex
description: Located in the heart of the city, on a bustling avenue, Sala is a must-visit destination that will leave you wanting more. This complex offers a range of activities, including entertainment, dining, and accommodation, making it perfect for a relaxing getaway or a fun outing with friends, colleagues, or family.|||The vast Sala Amusement Park features a wide range of services, allowing you to have an unforgettable experience without wanting to leave. With its modern, youthful design and elegant, traditional touches, the architecture boasts sleek lines, A-shaped roofs, and a vibrant, harmonious color palette reminiscent of Southeast Asia.

title: Visit the Southern Regional Headquarters Base
description: The historic site of the Southern Regional Headquarters Base lies north of Tây Ninh province, near the Vietnam‑Cambodia border, about 60 km from Tây Ninh town.|||The historic site is also known by several other names, such as R (the secret code name of the Southern Central Committee); Camp Chang Riệc (named after the forest area where the base was located); Camp Pham Hung (Comrade Pham Hung served as Secretary of the Central Committee for many years); Bac Tay Ninh Base. During both the anti-French and anti-American wars, the Southeast region overall and Tay Ninh in particular were strategic zones. The Bac Tay Ninh Base served as the headquarters of the Southern revolutionary leadership for a long period and directly directed the southern revolution until the South was fully liberated.|||The historical site of the Central Headquarters of the Southern Region consists of three zones: the Central Headquarters of the Southern Region, the National Liberation Front of South Vietnam (Viet Cong) Headquarters, and the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam Headquarters.|||1. Southern Regional Headquarters Base|||In March 1951, the first Central Committee Conference (second term) decided to establish the Southern Region Central Office, appointing Comrade Le Duan as Secretary and Comrade Le Duc Tho as Deputy Secretary. Later, Comrade Le Duc Tho was appointed Secretary and Comrade Pham Hung became Deputy Secretary. On September 6, 1954, the Politburo dissolved the Southern Region Central Office and reestablished the Southern Provincial Party Committee and district committees.|||On 23 January 1961, the third meeting of the Party Central Committee's Executive Board (III term) decided to re-establish the Southern Regional Central Committee. In early 1965, the Central Committee was tasked with overseeing the Southern region and the far south of the Central region, and comrade Nguyen Van Linh, Secretary of the Southern Provincial Party Committee, assumed the role of Secretary of the Central Committee.|||During 1967–1975, Comrade Pham Hung served as Secretary; Comrades Nguyen Van Linh, Phan Van Dang and Hoang Van Thai served as Deputy Secretaries of the Central Office.|||The base was built in the Chàng Riệc forest of Rùm Đuôn, nestled within untouched primary forest with multiple canopy layers. The living quarters and work rooms are elevated above the ground; all posts, beams and braces are made of wood, and the roof is thatched with trung quan leaves. Underground shelters are typically placed next to the housing and work areas, sinking deep into the earth.|||Currently, this site is planned into two main zones:|||- Historic site: restored main residence, a large hall, a small hall, guard house, office, Hoang Cam kitchen, and the living and working quarters of comrades Nguyen Van Linh, Nguyen Chi Thanh, Vo Van Kiet, Pham Hung, among others. The combat trench network, including the distinctive frog-shaped trenches, runs continuously along the whole route.|||- The memorial complex includes a reception hall, exhibition area, and a shrine honoring heroic martyrs. The total built area of this zone is 750m2.|||2. Base of the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam|||On December 20, 1960, at Trảng Chiêng in Tân Lập commune, Chau Thành district (now Tân Biên district, Tây Ninh province), the National Liberation Front of South Vietnam was founded and a provisional Central Committee was appointed. The Front later held a series of national congresses:|||The first National Liberation Front of South Vietnam Representative Congress (February 16 – March 3, 1962) and the second (November 11–18, 1964).|||- From 15 to 20 August 1967, in the North Tây Ninh base area, the irregular congress of the Front adopted a political program as the basis for establishing the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam. This was the third and final congress.|||This historic site is located along the Cho Stream and consists of three distinct functional zones:|||- The original historic site includes: the guard house, the liaison house, the guest house, the residences of comrades Nguyen Huu Tho, Phung Van Cung, Vo Chi Cong, the Hoang Cam kitchen, an assembly hall, and several sections of trench roads and shelter tunnels…;|||- The memorial complex includes a gatehouse, a reception hall, and an exhibition hall;|||- Protected area: integrated with the natural landscape.|||3. Provisional Revolutionary Government Headquarters of the Republic of South Vietnam|||From 6-8 June 1969, in the Tan Not forest of Chau Thanh district (now Tan Bien district, Tay Ninh province), the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam was formed. Architect Huynh Tan Phat served as its chairman, and lawyer Nguyen Huu Tho chaired the Advisory Council.|||The Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam headquarters, covering 60ha, is divided into three zones:|||- The original historic complex comprises the workhouse, dining hall, Hoang Cam kitchen, shelter bunker, and trench communications.|||- The complex includes a reception building, exhibition space, guest lounge, workroom, and a brewery;|||- Protected area: integrated with natural landscape.|||The historic site of the Southern Central Committee Base holds special significance. Over 15 years (1961-1975), the Central Committee turned many Party policies and President Ho Chi Minh’s directives into concrete actions in the South, issuing numerous directives and resolutions that shaped the revolutionary strategy across the southern battlefield. History shows that establishing the Southern Central Committee Base was a wise and innovative Party decision. The Base left valuable lessons on building strong bases, mobilizing the people in revolutionary movements, and especially on Party building.|||The Southern Central Headquarters, once the revolutionary capital of South Vietnam, preserves the traces and memories of a grueling, sacrificial yet proud revolutionary struggle. It bears witness to senior Party leaders, countless officials and soldiers who fought in the holy war to liberate the nation from American aggression, especially in the Southern battlefields. This historic site is not only vital for preserving tradition and education, but also an attractive destination for both domestic and international visitors, particularly Vietnam’s younger generations.|||Recognizing its special significance, on May 10, 2012 the Prime Minister classified the Southern Regional Central Headquarters site as a Special National Historical Monument (Decision No. 548/QD‑TTG).

title: Mat Tower
description: Mat Tower is recognized by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism as a historic-cultural site and is one of only three remaining ancient towers in southern Vietnam. The entire structure is built of brick and slab stone, with a sharply tapering summit that reaches an estimated height of 10 m from the ground.|||The bricks are stacked tightly, leaving almost no gaps, which is striking. The main wall faces east, while the other three sides turn toward west, south and north. The tower showcases the sophisticated craftsmanship of the ancient Óc Eo civilization.|||Rising from a raised mound in the middle of a field, the tower looks from a distance like a pen tip stretching upward. It is a worthwhile spot for visitors to explore.

title: Nha Mat Tourist Area
description: Nha Mat Tourist Area is the most famous attraction in Bac Lieu. It features a large artificial beach and a host of fun activities such as a soaring air ride, electric buggy rides, a 6D cinema, and a massage lounge. It promises to be the perfect spot to beat the sweltering summer heat for visitors.

title: Tan Lap Floating Village
description: Tan Lap Floating Village lies deep within the flooded forests of the Mekong Delta’s Dong Thap Muoi region, a wetland ecosystem typical of southeastern Vietnam. Cajuput trees, lotus, water lilies, water caltrops and abundant wildlife such as storks and pangasius catfish give the area its own palette of colours. The plain of Long An offers simple, unpretentious scenery that soothes the soul.|||Tan Lap is an eco‑tourism destination in Tan Lap commune, Moc Hoa district, Long An province. The village is interlaced with the Rach Rung canal and the Vam Co Tay River.|||Beyond the floating houses, the site includes a natural reserve, a forest garden, a wildlife migration zone, a boat dock and more. That’s why a one‑day visit never feels boring – there’s always something new to explore.|||Because it is a flooded‑forest eco‑park surrounded by green cajuput woods, you can visit any season. However, for picture‑perfect moments, come during the flood season when plants and animals are at their most vibrant. Visiting outside this period offers little interest. Travelers are advised to go during the high‑water months, when the landscape resembles a miniature Mekong West, the hallmark of Tan Lap. The flood season runs from August to November (lunar calendar), coinciding with the central‑Vietnam rainy season.|||When the waters rise, many birds return to build nests and feed on the plentiful fish. This time also brings a bounty of riverine specialties. Lotus and water lily blossoms cover the village, providing spectacular photo opportunities.|||Tan Lap is ideal for nature lovers seeking peace. Entrance is 60,000 VND per person; boat rides with a guide cost an additional 30,000 VND per person. Boat operators double as guides, steering you through the vast marshes and lush vegetation. In October‑November, when lotus are in full bloom, boats can take you to the stunning lotus fields for unforgettable selfies.|||Tan Lap remains a relatively untouched destination, so culinary options are modest. Simple, rustic river‑front dishes are available, and visitors may bring their own food for a communal picnic. Still, trying the local village fare is part of the experience.

title: Endless Field Tourist Area
description: This tourist area is a biodiversity reserve, nurturing many rare plant species and precious herbs. It was also the backdrop for the famous film 'Endless Field'. Following the film's huge success, the site has become a popular tourist destination in Long An province.

title: King Coconut Tree Avenue in Tan Tru
description: About 40km south of Ho Chi Minh City lies a road often referred to as the "happy road". For years, the King Coconut Tree Avenue in Tan Tru, Long An, has been a popular check-in spot for tourists on weekends.|||An iconic road for nearly 30 years.|||Tan Tru District is nestled between the Vam Co Dong and Vam Co Tay rivers, with fertile alluvial soil perfect for growing lush fruits and trees. Visitors to Tan Tru Town often ask about the King Coconut Tree Avenue, and locals are always happy to share its location. The road has long been a symbol of the local community.|||The over 2km concrete road features two rows of straight and lush king coconut trees, surrounded by rice fields and green dragon fruit orchards, making it a source of pride for the locals. As you walk along the road, you'll feel like you're part of the beautiful scenery, which lives up to the road's nickname.|||Tan Tru Town in Long An Province is not only known for its achievements in rural transportation but also for its beautiful rural roads lined with flowers and trees. These concrete roads are surrounded by rice fields, with morning glory flowers and bean grass planted along the edges, and many roads are lined with two rows of lush coconut trees.|||Anyone who has visited Tan Tru Town in Long An Province is familiar with the King Coconut Tree Avenue near the local junior high school. The nearly 1km road features over 300 large coconut trees, making it a pride of the local community. The concrete road, lined with two rows of green coconut trees, passes through a field of golden rice, making anyone who walks through it feel happy.|||Taking photos until your hands ache.|||In addition to tourists who come to take photos, many couples choose this spot for their wedding photos to capture the special moments of their lives.|||Visitors to the King Coconut Tree Avenue at any time of day will catch unforgettable moments. At dawn, the misty scenery surrounding the coconut trees creates a romantic atmosphere. In the afternoon, the road is filled with images of students in their white uniforms riding their bikes home from school.

title: Bac Lieu Bird Sanctuary
description: If you're planning a trip to the Mekong Delta, be sure to visit the Bac Lieu Bird Sanctuary, a nature reserve that offers a tranquil atmosphere and a glimpse into the region's wild side.|||The sanctuary is a remnant of the coastal mangrove forest, which has been naturally expanded to 385ha, including 19ha of primary forest, and is home to around 46 bird species, including the spotted necked grebe and the blackheaded ibis, 150 animal species, and 109 plant species, making it a rich and diverse ecosystem.|||As the sun sets, flocks of birds return to their nests, flying in an orderly fashion, separated by species, with some flying in arrow-like formations and others in a more scattered pattern, creating a lively atmosphere in the forest.|||In the late afternoon, the forest takes on a soft, gentle appearance, with the trees swaying in the breeze and the birds flying back to their nests, each species occupying its own territory, with the black cormorants perched on the highest branches and the white egrets resting on the middle tiers.|||The forest comes alive with the sounds of leaves rustling, wings flapping, and birds calling, creating a symphony that welcomes visitors from afar.|||As night falls, the nocturnal birds wake up and begin their activities, breaking the silence of the night, and the sounds of the forest are like a breath of fresh air, reconnecting humans with nature.|||Thanks to the investment from the local government, a canal has been dug around the sanctuary, along with a water reservoir and a fish pond, which have helped to restore the natural environment and attract a growing number of bird species, making the sanctuary an even more diverse and vibrant ecosystem.

title: Cao Van Lau Memorial Area
description: In 2008, this site was renovated and expanded over an area of approximately 2,800m2, featuring structures such as a triple-gate entrance, a tomb shelter for musician Cao Van Lau, a half-statue of Cao Van Lau, an exhibit house for documents, artifacts, and images of musicians, an outdoor stage, and a guest reception house.|||Located in ward 2, Bac Lieu city, the Cao Van Lau Memorial Area was originally the ancestral tomb of the musician's family. It was later restored and expanded with additional structures to host significant events and welcome distant visitors. The Cao Van Lau musician memorial was added to the list of National Intangible Cultural Heritage by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism in 2012.|||The Cao Van Lau memorial area in Bac Lieu features several structures, including the tomb of musician Cao Van Lau and his family, a bust of Cao Van Lau, and an exhibit area showcasing images and artifacts of the founders of Southern Vietnam's reformed theater. Notably, there is also a symbolic dan kìm (a type of zither) area and an outdoor stage, among other attractions.|||Upon entering the main gate, visitors will come across a bamboo flute monument situated in the memorial area. This monument is a stylized đàn kìm, a symbol of Southern Vietnam's traditional music. The đàn kìm is crafted from a bamboo node, with its hollowed-out sections creating an air of mystery and sanctity, evoking nostalgia and paying tribute to the deceased. This is also where visitors can pay their respects and offer incense.|||The mystical and sacred aspect here is the arrangement of steps leading to the bamboo pipe platform, with the number of steps symbolizing the rhythms and beats of traditional reformed theater, corresponding to each artist's creation: 2 steps for Cao Văn Lầu, 4 steps for Trịnh Thiên Tư, 8 steps for Lư Hòa Nghĩ, 16 steps for Mộng Vân, 32 steps for Trần Tấn Hưng, and 64 steps for Lý Khi.|||The stone staircase, made from green Thanh Hoa stone, features intricate carvings of dragons. The dragons' shapes follow the stairs, blending with cloud patterns to create a meaningful combination. As Bạc Liêu is known as the cradle of đờn ca tài tử (a type of traditional music), which flourished most in the southern region, the development and spread of this music are likened to a dragon.|||Surrounding the bamboo flute monument are 20 stone carvings of folk songs, including 3 Nam, 6 Bac, 4 Oan, and 7 large Bac songs. Behind the symbol of the Kìm instrument is a statue of musician Cao Van Lau. His famous piece, 'Da co hoai lang', is engraved on the back.|||Beyond the symbol of the kìm ensemble is a park featuring symbols of various musical instruments, all of which are part of the Southern Vietnam traditional music art. These include the flute, đàn cò (a type of harp), đàn tranh (16-string zither), đàn bầu (monochord), and guitar. What sets this instrument garden apart is that all the instruments are carved from green stone, looking sturdy and soulful, with the stone's color harmonizing with the greenery around.|||To the left is a memorial house dedicated to the late musician Cao Van Lau. On the right are service blocks. Finally, there's a performance building for traditional don ca tai tu music, situated on a lotus pond.|||For a glimpse into the treasured documents of traditional Vietnamese music and theater, or to admire images of renowned cai luong artists from Bac Lieu, the exhibition area is a must-visit. Inside, visitors can find stage costumes of famous cai luong artists and wax figures depicting traditional music performances, along with ancient instruments used by skilled artisans.|||Visitors will explore the golden age of Vietnamese traditional music and cải lương, as well as delve into the historical context of 'Dạ Cổ Hoài Lang' (Longing for My Husband on a Drumming Night). For over 100 years since its creation, Cao Văn Lầu's timeless love song 'Dạ cổ hoài lang' still resonates with millions of Vietnamese hearts, evoking profound marital love and devotion.

title: Phu An Bamboo Village
description: Born from an ecological bamboo conservation project, Phu An Bamboo Village (in Phu An commune, Ben Cat town) has transformed into a 'green tourism' destination, welcoming around 10,000 domestic and international visitors annually. The local tourism industry is currently promoting it to become a major attraction for visitors from around the world.

title: Thuy Chau Tourist Area
description: Thuy Chau is a newly emerged tourist destination near Saigon, popular among young people and families as a weekend getaway spot. Located about 25km from Saigon, in Binh Thang commune, Di An town, Binh Duong province.|||For those seeking a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of city life in Saigon, or simply looking for a short trip to bond with loved ones, Thuy Chau Tourist Area in Binh Duong is an ideal choice.|||Built as an 18-hectare artificial entertainment complex, the scenery here, from the treetops to the streams and forests, exudes a natural and serene atmosphere.|||At first glance, you'll be captivated by the scenery, with lush green trees lining the entrance, winding along the path to the largest artificial waterfall in Binh Duong province.|||The romantic landscape, reminiscent of Korea, with fallen leaves scattered on the ground, will leave you in awe. Be sure to capture these wonderful moments with your phone.|||In Thuy Chau, you'll immerse yourself in endless nature: lush green grass, meandering streams, and birds singing melodiously...|||All of these elements combine to create a breathtakingly beautiful scene that will make you forget you're in an artificial tourist area. Many visitors have praised Thuy Chau, comparing it to a miniature Da Lat, with its green landscapes, fresh air, and serene atmosphere.|||Visiting Thuy Chau Tourist Area, you'll have an unforgettable experience, swimming in the cool, clear waters of the artificial waterfall. Invite your friends and family to join you and let the powerful flow of the waterfall wash away your worries.|||Although it's an artificial waterfall, it looks like a natural wonder. The water flows gently under the falls, passing through rocks scattered along the stream, creating a beautiful landscape like a watercolor painting.|||Thuy Chau Tourist Area is truly an ideal picnic spot that you shouldn't miss, with its unique blend of natural beauty and modern amenities. Not only can you enjoy the majestic natural scenery reminiscent of Da Lat, but you can also take stunning photos like in Korea, and experience the modern European-style pool area. With a massive 1,200m2 area, this will be the perfect space for you and your loved ones to relax and unwind.

title: Dau Tieng Lake Tourist Complex
description: Dau Tieng Lake is situated on the border of three provinces: Binh Duong, Binh Phuoc, and Tay Ninh, playing a crucial role in the regional economic development, especially in water management. Notably, it is the largest artificial lake in the country, covering an area of 27km2 and holding an average of 1.58 billion cubic meters of water. While its primary function is to supply water to the Saigon River and surrounding areas, in recent years, the lake has also been developed for tourism, becoming a popular destination that welcomes thousands of visitors annually.

title: Công viên nước Thanh Lễ
description: Công viên có hồ thiếu nhi dành riêng cho trẻ em. Trẻ em đến đây có thể chơi các trò chơi với tàu chaỵ bằng hơi nước, các máng trượt nhỏ, các hình tượng nấm, rùa, cá sấu phun nước…phù hợp với lứa tuổi thiếu nhi.|||Ngoài ra công viên còn có hồ tạo sóng với nhiều chương trình chơi sóng hấp dẫn: sóng cao 0.9m và đợt sóng ngắn, sóng đơn, sóng kép, sóng đan xen…|||Sau thời gian vui chơi khách có thể thư giãn với dòng sông lười. Đặc biệt dòng sông lười tạo nên vòng xoáy, tạo cảm giác thích thú mới lạ.|||Bên cạnh các hồ bơi còn có hệ thống máng trượt, có máng trượt ba làn độ cao 6m, các loại máng trượt xoắn kín, xoắn hở độ cao 9m tạo cảm giác mạnh, từ trên cao rơi xuống hồ.

title: Gió & Nước Café Bình Dương
description: Designed by renowned architect Võ Trọng Nghĩa, this café's main concept revolves around utilizing natural water and ventilation to cool the space, creating a sense of openness and closeness to nature.|||In 2016, the wNw Cafe, designed by Võ Trọng Nghĩa and his team, made its mark in Bình Dương with a unique design that won second prize at the 2006 Vietnam Architecture Awards, and later, Võ Trọng Nghĩa became the first Vietnamese to win the gold medal at the 2007-2008 Arcasia Awards for the 'Wind and Water' café in Bình Dương. The café continued to achieve success with awards such as second prize in the international bamboo architecture competition organized by Bamboo Technologies Maui (USA) in 2007, and the International Architecture Award (IAA) in the USA in 2009.|||Its appearance immediately caught the attention of modern, stylish customers who love nature, and it has proven its unique appeal to customers visiting the café. 'Bình Dương is changing, and demands are changing with the unique features of the project; we will attract all customers from inside and outside the province and foreign tourists who love the essence of Vietnam, Vietnamese culture, and the Vietnamese soul,' the café owner shared.|||The wNw architecture remains close to nature and people, as seen in the open space overlooking the street and the use of natural materials like bamboo, wood, and stone. The image of the wNw café is designed to convey the traditional values of Vietnamese culture, which is the purity of the lotus flower. The bamboo garden with its green color reflects the communal bond between family and friends, making it an ideal meeting spot for customers looking to relax after work and escape the confines of home. Not only is it a harmonious combination of aesthetic space through scientific interior arrangement, but the project has also utilized wind energy and the cooling ability of water to create a natural air conditioner. A notable change is the central bar, which has been refined to serve groups of friends, families, and organizations celebrating birthdays, parties, and special occasions.|||In the new plan, wNw will have entertainment programs, lucky draws, music, and interactions with singers from Ho Chi Minh City and Bình Dương. The prices of drinks and light meals will also be adjusted to suit customers from inside and outside the country.

title: Phuoc Loc Tho Ancient Village Tourist Area
description: Located in Hựu Thạnh commune, Đức Hòa district, Long An province, Phước Lộc Thọ ancient village is a unique tourist destination in Long An. The entire village covers about 10 hectares and was started in 2006. Some main activities in the village include visiting the ancient house complex, exploring the orchid garden, old trees, and rockery, and visiting the zoo...

title: Binh Thanh Ancient Tower
description: Located on the right bank of the Vam Co Dong River, Binh Thanh ancient tower is a remnant of the Oc Eo culture, dating back to the 8th century. The tower stands 10m tall, with each side measuring 5m, and is oriented towards the four cardinal directions.|||The main entrance of the tower faces East, while the other three sides feature intricately carved false doors adorned with beautiful patterns.|||Considered a remarkably sturdy and elaborate architectural work, the tower has survived for centuries with minimal damage, a testament to its enduring construction. Discovered by the Indochina Research Institute in 1886, the tower was classified as an architectural and artistic monument in 1993 and restored in 1999.|||The site attracts an increasing number of tourists, and if you're visiting Tay Ninh, be sure to stop by this incredible landmark!

title: Go Chua Fruit Garden
description: Mentioning the Southern region, everyone thinks of the freshest and most delicious fruit gardens, and Tay Ninh is no exception. Go Chua Fruit Garden is a popular destination where you can explore vast orchards and savor the fresh, cool taste of various fruits right at the garden.|||The hospitality and enthusiasm of the locals in these fruit gardens will also leave a lasting impression on you, making the experience even more memorable. Additionally, you can hand-pick fruits to bring back as gifts for your loved ones.

title: Tân Tuyến Cajuput Forest Ecotourism
description: An Giang is a land that leaves a strong impression on many tourists, not only because it is a place where many unique cultures of the Kinh, Chinese, Cham, and Khmer communities blend and converge, but also because it possesses the simple, characteristic beauty of the Mekong Delta's riverine landscape and diverse natural scenery, from vast green rice fields, the dreamy Cô Tô Mountain, the tall sugar palm trees of Tịnh Biên reaching for the sky, to the mysterious Thất Sơn range and many other attractive historical and cultural sites.|||But perhaps the most memorable destination when traveling to An Giang is the vast, lush cajuput forests. In addition to the poetic and picturesque Tra Su Forest, which has become a top check-in spot in the Mekong Delta, Tan Tuyen Forest is also attracting a large number of tourists lately. Let's explore this attractive An Giang travel destination with LuhanhVietNam!|||Located in Tri Ton and Tinh Bien districts, Tan Tuyen Melaleuca Forest is a popular An Giang tourist destination, covering 1752 ha of the district's total 1928.4 ha area.|||An Giang province, including Tan Tuyen forest, has great potential for developing eco-tourism, thanks to its incredibly rich flora and fauna. Some notable eco-tourism spots in An Giang include Keo Heaven God forest, Ba Pond on Cam Mountain, Keo O Tuk Xa forest in Chi Lang, Soai So Lake mango forest in Tri Ton district, and the ancient Heaven God forest on Co To mountain in Tri Ton, and now Tan Tuyen forest.|||This place boasts not only a vast expanse of lush green cajuput forest but also a dominant algae industry with numerous species, including green algae, siliceous algae, blue-green algae, golden algae, eye algae, yellow algae, and armored algae. Many of these species serve as nutritious food for fish and shrimp in the forest.|||This is a significant advantage of the forest as it allows for the development of a complete tourism service to recreate military life. This helps tourists have attractive and engaging military life experiences. If you're a fan of the popular 2020 reality show 'Sao nhập ngũ' then you shouldn't miss this forest.|||Tan Tuyen Cajuput Forest features a military camp system, watchtowers, and the Hoang Cam kitchen. Photo: Lang Thang An Giang|||While Tra Su Forest has a long wooden bridge and a beautiful bird nest dock reminiscent of Europe, Tan Tuyen Forest in An Giang has its own 5,000m-long wooden plank bridge connecting the main area to smaller trails, winding through the forest to bring visitors closer to nature.|||Take a motorboat ride through the cajuput forest to admire the flora and fauna, or stroll along the shaded walkways to discover the pristine beauty of the surroundings, and don't forget to capture the moment with dreamy photos at this new and exciting destination in An Giang.|||In addition to its natural beauty, Tan Tuyen Cajuput Forest in An Giang Province offers various eco-tourism activities that promise to bring new experiences of flooding season tourism in the Western region, such as net casting, fishing, and crab catching, and savoring delicious countryside cuisine with many specialties from Chau Doc, Tinh Bien, Tri Ton, and more.|||More good news for tourists who love the Western region: a rest stop for food and drinks is being completed to serve visitors, expected to be finished before the 2021 Lunar New Year.|||Explore Tan Tuyen Forest An Giang - a preserved mangrove forest|||The area is being planned for eco-tourism development|||Covering an area of 1,672 hectares, Tan Tuyen Melaleuca Forest in An Giang is being listed as a protected wetland nature reserve. Part of this, 250 hectares in Zone A, is planned for tourism development. The forest's protected area will include three functional sub-zones, all in sub-zone 30B. Notably, the most strictly protected sub-zone spans 81.85 hectares, comprising lots 6, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, adjacent to An Giang Provincial Army Forest Station.|||The ecological restoration subzone covers approximately 94.06ha, comprising zones 7, 8, 9, and 16 (in subzone 30B). Finally, the administrative and service subzone spans a total of 80.48ha, including zones 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.|||The buffer zone of Tan Tuyen Cajuput Forest Landscape Protection Area in An Giang Province covers approximately 380.9 hectares, located in Tan Duc, Tan An, and Tan Loi hamlets, Tan Tuyen commune, Tinh Bien district. With its planning and special investment regime, this pristine cajuput forest promises to be a new destination in An Giang, so let's plan to explore it with friends in early 2021.

title: My Khanh Strawberry Garden in An Giang
description: This strawberry garden is worth a visit. From Long Xuyen, cross Ton Duc Thang Bridge (parallel to Quay Bridge), then follow the sign to turn left into My Khanh. After about 30 minutes, you'll arrive.|||It's best to go early in the morning when the strawberries are still ripe and haven't been harvested yet. Note that purple strawberries are ripe, while red ones are not. The garden owner is friendly and welcoming, allowing you to pick strawberries freely, but please don't overdo it. You can buy strawberries at 30-40 thousand per kilogram. They also have strawberry smoothies for 15,000 dong. Additionally, you can enjoy steamed snails with lemongrass and a dipping sauce made with a type of citrus fruit. All in all, it's a delicious, nutritious, and affordable experience. A great spot for an eco-friendly outing!

title: Yen Tu Historical and Scenic Site
description: The Yen Tu Historical and Scenic Site stretches nearly 20 km across Phuong Dong ward and Thượng Yên Công commune, Uong Bi city, Quang Ninh province, classified as a national historical site in 1974 and recognized as a Special National Site in 2012.|||Yen Tu Mountain stands at 1,068m above sea level, the highest peak of the Yen Tu mountain range in the Dong Trieu Arc. For centuries, Yen Tu has been revered as a sacred land of 'địa linh' (holy land) and 'phúc địa' (blessed land). The area boasts breathtaking scenery and preserves the long-standing historical and cultural values of Vietnam.|||Yen Tu Mountain has had many names throughout history, including Phu Van Son (Floating Cloud Mountain), Tuong Son (Elephant Mountain), Yen Son (Yen Mountain), Bach Van Son (White Cloud Mountain), and Linh Son (Sacred Mountain). The name 'Yen Tu Mountain' originates from a legend about a northern hermit named An Ky Sinh, who came to the mountain to practice his spiritual craft, built a hermitage, and gathered rare medicinal herbs to create an elixir of immortality. The locals admired and revered him, calling him Thay An (meaning 'Peaceful Master'), and the mountain was named after him as Thay An Mountain. During the Le Trung Hưng period, to avoid using the same title as An Do Vuong Trinh Cuong, the name 'An' was mispronounced as 'Yen', and An Tu was changed to Yen Tu.|||Yen Tu is the birthplace of Truc Lam Yen Tu Zen, a place associated with the name and extraordinary career of the King who became a Buddha - the heroic Emperor Tran Nhan Tong. After leading the people of Dai Viet to victory against the Yuan Mongol invaders in 1285 and 1288, he renounced the throne, became a monk, and came to Yen Tu to practice (in August 1299) with the Dharma name Hương Vân Đại Đầu Đà, and the title Trúc Lâm Đại Sỹ, founding the Truc Lam Yen Tu Zen school, which has a profound influence on the development of Vietnamese Buddhism.|||Yen Tu Historical and Cultural Vestige is a complex of Buddhist architectural structures, comprising 10 pagodas: Bi Thượng (Trình) Pagoda, Suối Tắm Pagoda, Cầm Thực Pagoda, Lân Pagoda - Trúc Lâm Yen Tu Zen Institute, Giải Oan Pagoda, Hoa Yên Pagoda, Một Mái Pagoda, Bảo Sái Pagoda, Vân Tiêu Pagoda, Đồng Pagoda; many hermitage ruins like Lò Rèn Hermitage, Thiền Định Hermitage, Diêm Hermitage, Hoa Hermitage, Dược Hermitage…; and numerous tomb towers worshiping Zen masters from the Tran - Le era, concentrated in tower gardens: Huệ Quang, Hòn Ngọc, Lân Pagoda, Vọng Tiên Cung or located in front of pagodas: Bí Thượng, Giải Oan, Một Mái, Bảo Sái… along with thousands of ancient artifacts within the 2,783ha Yen Tu National Forest, featuring a rich and diverse system of flora and fauna, with many species listed in Vietnam's Red Book. Yen Tu can be likened to a living museum of historical, cultural, and spiritual values, as well as a museum of biological diversity.|||- The Yên Tử (Yen Tu) relic and landscape complex has been completed with a dossier submitted to UNESCO for recognition as a world heritage site, in cooperation between Quảng Ninh (Quang Ninh) province and the neighboring provinces of Hải Dương (Hai Duong) and Bắc Giang (Bac Giang).|||This name refers to two large mountain ranges in the shape of a crescent, including Năm Mẫu (Yên Tử) and Bình Liêu, along with the slate hill area between them. The East Wing is located in the eastern part of Northeast Vietnam, spanning across Quảng Ninh, Lạng Sơn, Bắc Giang, Hải Dương, and Hải Phòng provinces.|||According to the Complete Annals of Dai Viet

title: Ba Vang Pagoda
description: Located on Thanh Dang Mountain in the Dong Trieu range, Ba Vang Pagoda is situated in Quang Trung ward, Uong Bi city, Quang Ninh province. Its Chinese name, Bao Quang Tu, translates to a temple of precious light. The pagoda is also known as Ba Vang, referring to the three precious gems of Buddhism: Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.|||According to the Chinese inscriptions on a stone incense burner, the pagoda was originally built in 1705, during the reign of King Le Du Tong. After centuries, the old pagoda was destroyed, leaving behind only a few artifacts like stone steles, stone turtles, and broken tiles. In 1988, a new pagoda was constructed from wood, and in 1993, it was rebuilt using stone, brick, and cement on a smaller scale, covering an area of approximately 1,400 square meters.|||In 2007, the pagoda was recognized as a provincial historical and cultural relic. In 2009, the Quang Ninh provincial government approved a plan to preserve and restore the pagoda. With the support of local authorities, Buddhists, and visitors, the pagoda's first phase of construction began in 2011. By 2014, the first phase of the restoration project was completed, covering an area of 22,000 square meters, with several large-scale constructions, including the 4,500 square meter Great Bell Temple, Bell Tower, Drum Tower, and other facilities. In 2014, the pagoda held a grand opening ceremony and received a record for having the largest main hall in Indochina.|||To meet the cultural and spiritual needs of Buddhists and visitors, the pagoda continued its second phase of construction, including the Great Lecture Hall, the Great Trai Hall, a kitchen, a 9,000 square meter Buddhist area, the Golden Bridge, and a statue of Buddha. With these impressive Buddhist cultural and spiritual constructions, Ba Vang Pagoda has received a world record for the largest Buddhist lecture hall on a mountain, certified by the Worldings and WRA.

title: Dinh Den Cong - Long Khanh Pagoda - Co Linh Shrine
description: Dinh Den Cong, whose Chinese name is 'Den Cong Dinh', originated from the village of Den Cong, which later became Dien Cong, now known as Den Cong 2 ward, Uong Bi city, Quang Ninh province. About 1km southwest of Dinh Den Cong lies Co Linh Shrine (also known as Cay Gieng Shrine). Dinh Den Cong is a special national relic within the Bach Dang Dinh historical complex in Trưng Vương ward, Uong Bi city, Quang Ninh province.|||The communal house is dedicated to the village's tutelary deity, comprising deities such as Tran Hung Dao, the highest-ranking deity, and five generals who helped him achieve the great victory at Bach Dang: Cao Son, Quy Minh, Nam Hai Ton Than, Phi Bong Tuong Quan, and Bach Thach Tuong Quan. These deities revealed in a dream to Hung Dao Vuong the location of the ancient Cay Gieng tree near Dinh Dien Cong, where he could set up a signal fire to launch a unified attack against the invading Mongol fleet, leading to the historic Battle of Bach Dang in 1288. After the battle, Tran Hung Dao held a ceremony to thank the deities and renamed the village Den Cong, which translates to 'Temple of Gratitude'. Later, the people revered him as the village's tutelary deity, and a temple was built in his honor. The name 'Dinh Den Cong' reflects the people's gratitude towards the national heroes who fought against foreign invaders.|||Dinh Dien Cong has a close relationship with Co Linh Shrine, located about 1km away, in a Dinh-Mieu (Temple-Shrine) complex. According to legend and folklore, Co Linh Shrine was built in the early 14th century but was damaged by a flood in 1954, leaving only its foundation. The villagers then brought the shrine's artifacts to Dinh Den Cong for worship. In 2014, the shrine was rebuilt, and its grounds were expanded and renovated by 2017.|||Every year, on the 13th, 14th, and 15th days of the first lunar month, the communal house holds a spring festival to honor the deities and pray for a prosperous new year with abundant harvests and good fortune.|||Long Khanh Pagoda is located adjacent to Dinh Den Cong, on its left side, and is a long-standing place of Buddhist worship and cultural activities for the local community.|||Along with other relics like the Bach Dang stakes, the Vua Ba Shrine, and several communal houses, Dinh Den Cong - Long Khanh Pagoda - Co Linh Shrine is a key part of the Bach Dang Victory Historical Complex.||||||[1] According to Dinh Den Cong's deity records, Cao Son and Quy Minh are considered a single entity, referred to as the Four Great Generals.

title: Pho Am Pagoda
description: Located at the foot of Duat Van mountain in Bac Son ward, 4km from Uong Bi city center, Pho Am Pagoda is also known as Am Pagoda (or Am Van Tu in Chinese characters). The name Pho Am can be interpreted as 'broad understanding', with 'Pho' meaning 'wide' and 'Am' meaning 'understanding'.|||According to the inscription on the stone incense burner, one of the ancient artifacts still preserved today, Am Pagoda was built in 1705 during the reign of King Le Du Tong, under the Vinh Thinh era. Pho Am Pagoda was constructed on a high, airy, and bright plot of land, with its facade facing southeast. A small stream runs in front of the pagoda, with the gentle Uong River in the distance. This stunning location creates a serene and peaceful atmosphere.|||Over its 300-year history, Pho Am Pagoda has undergone several restorations. The first renovation took place in 1802 during the reign of King Gia Long. In 1979, the pagoda underwent major repairs. In 1994, the worship hall was rebuilt, and in 2002, the entire Main Hall, ancestral house, and other structures were restored.|||Today, Pho Am Pagoda showcases the architectural style of the Nguyen dynasty. The main hall, designed in the shape of the Chinese character 'Cong', covers an area of 350m² and features 3 front chambers, 2 side chambers, and 3 rear chambers. The pagoda serves as both a place of Buddhist worship and a hub for cultural and spiritual activities for the local community.

title: Lung Xanh Waterfall
description: Located just over 2km from Uong Bi city, in Quang Trung ward, Lung Xanh is nestled in a sacred area connected to Yen Tu Mountain, Trung Yen Lake, and shares the same water source as Ba Vang Pagoda.|||Lung Xanh boasts a rich natural vegetation, with many gentle streams and waterfalls meandering through the forest canopy, creating a breathtaking natural landscape with three consecutive waterfalls cascading down, cool and beautiful like a natural painting gifted to Uong Bi city. This is why it's called Lung Xanh, meaning “green-blue water”, surrounded by lush trees, consecutive waterfalls, and scattered rocks of various shapes and sizes along the winding stream that flows through the green forest. Each waterfall has clear and calm pools, reflecting the sky and forest, creating a fresh atmosphere and beautiful scenery.|||In addition to its natural beauty, the Lung Xanh area is closely linked to the Yen Tu historical site and connected to Yen Trung Lake, making it a special ecological area in Uong Bi that attracts tourists from near and far.

title: Museum - Library of Quang Ninh Province - October 30th Square
description: The Quang Ninh Museum and Library is a key project celebrating the 50th anniversary of the province's establishment (October 30th, 1963 - October 30th, 2013).|||With its unique architecture, beautiful space, and numerous valuable exhibits, the Quang Ninh Museum and Library has become a new tourist attraction, drawing large crowds of locals and visitors. The complex has a total investment of over 900 billion VND, comprising three interconnected buildings via elevated walkways, including the museum, library, and conference areas. The library building, adjacent to the museum, is designed in a modern style, with the ground floor storing over 100,000 books, newspapers, and magazines across various fields. However, the museum still has many empty spaces that have not been utilized for exhibits, such as the first-floor area featuring natural wonders, the third floor showcasing coal and a special exhibit on President Ho Chi Minh's connection to Quang Ninh, as well as the ethnic groups of Quang Ninh; the conference block only has an exhibit on artifacts on its second floor.

title: Ha Long Market 1
description: Located in the heart of Ha Long city, this market is the main commercial hub of Quang Ninh province. Stalls selling coal souvenirs, seafood products, wooden items, and fresh seafood, including squid cakes, attract many tourists. The market offers a wide range of goods, from everyday items to high-end products, with a significant portion being Chinese-made. The seafood here is fresh and affordable. Notably, Ha Long Market is famous for its squid cakes, which are grilled to perfection, emitting a tempting aroma that makes it hard for visitors to resist trying some and remembering the taste forever.

title: Vincom Ha Long Center
description: Designed in luxurious European royal style, this complex features a high-end shopping center, educational and health consulting services for children, a dining area, ice skating rink, cinema, and game zone. As the largest commercial center in Quang Ninh Province and one of the biggest in the northern region, Vincom Ha Long Center will be a landmark in the heart of Ha Long City, offering a comprehensive range of services and a must-visit tourist destination for travelers to Quang Ninh

title: Marine Plaza Shopping Center
description: The Ha Long Marine Plaza complex, invested and developed by Syrena Vietnam, features a range of unique services including entertainment zones, traditional craft villages, water parks, shopping centers, food courts, seafood night markets, and international standard cinemas. Ha Long Marine Plaza is a must-visit destination for tourists traveling to Ha Long Bay. Strategically located between Tuan Chau and Bai Chay, the complex welcomes a large number of tourists, around 2000-2500 international and domestic visitors daily. With synchronized planning, smooth transportation, and new developments since 2013, including the annual Carnaval festival and a new financial center, Ha Long Marine has become an ideal choice for tourism and hotel investors.|||

title: My Ngoc Pearl Center - Ha Long Pearl Joint Stock Company
description: This center showcases and sells pearl jewelry and souvenir products made from oyster shells, all of which are cultivated directly in Ha Long Bay using Japanese technology. The products are diverse and fashionable, attracting many tourists. Currently, My Ngoc Center has drawn in numerous tour groups, with the main clientele being European tourists, averaging around 1000 visitors per day. The center also offers a beautiful view of Ha Long Bay, a green tree system, and recreational activities for tourists, including fishing, lake viewing, and countryside photography.

title: Cai Lan Temple
description: Today, Cai Lan Temple (Temple of Cai Lan) no longer holds any historical evidence that can clearly tell its story. Legend has it that the temple dates back to the Tran Dynasty. Strategically located where six rivers meet the sea, Hung Dao Vuong had a temple built here to oversee the waters, and he brought incense from Mau Thac Han Son Temple in Ha Trung district, all the way from Thanh Hoa, to bless the temple. Many believe that the sacred power of the Mother Goddess helped the Tran army win against the Mongols in many naval battles in the Northeast. The temple once housed many statues, including a large, lifelike statue of the Mother Goddess in white attire, known as Bach Ngoc Thuy Tinh, whose piercing eyes seemed to follow you wherever you stood. In front of the temple stood two statues with sharp, intimidating eyes that nobody dared approach in the late afternoon. There were also statues of five high-ranking officials, a girl, and a boy outside. Over time, the temple has been rebuilt multiple times, and when Cai Lan Port was constructed, the temple was relocated to a higher area, resulting in the loss of many ancient artifacts. In 1986, a large number of ancient coins and artifacts were discovered in the old temple area, indicating that many pilgrims had visited and made offerings in the past. However, all signs have since been altered, and the grounds have been leveled, making it impossible to pinpoint the exact location of these ancient relics. In 2009, a new pagoda was built beside the temple within the Cai Lan Port area.|||

title: Loi Am Pagoda and Yen Lap Lake Relic Complex
description: Loi Am Pagoda is an ancient pagoda built in the 15th century (during the Le Thanh Tong era), set amidst a picturesque landscape with a harmonious blend of mountains and water, topped by Loi Am Mountain, featuring a natural 'heavenly chessboard' at its peak, standing 503m high, offering a panoramic view of the Northeast region, rivaling that of Tan Vien and Tam Dao.|||Yen Lap Lake was constructed in 1976, combining beautifully with the surrounding landscape to create a scenic spot. The Loi Am Pagoda - Yen Lap Lake historical relic complex has formed a romantic landscape, famous since ancient times, and now even more renowned for attracting tourists interested in cultural, spiritual, and ecological tourism.

title: Tung Sau Pearl Farm
description: Tung Sau boasts stunning scenery and calm seas. It's home to a pearl farming and processing area operated by Ha Long Pearl Joint Stock Company, a product being developed as part of Quang Ninh's tourism product development plan. The company's processing, display, and sales area has been recognized as a standard restaurant.

title: Quang La Flower Paradise
description: The eco-tourism site 'Quang La Flower Paradise' is part of the 'Fruit Tree Garden and Eco-Tourism' project in Quang La commune, approved by the Hoanh Bo District People's Committee in Decision No. 926/QD-UBND on June 1, 2015. The project is implemented in two phases. Currently, phase 1 of the project has been completed, including: planting fruit trees in combination with medicinal plants; a multicolored flower field; building a workshop for preliminary processing of medicinal herbs, a net house for plant breeding; forming a medicinal herb maze, a coconut tree house and a bar, a cafe on the tree serving visitors. Tourists can experience gardening, harvesting medicinal herbs, processing medicinal herbs; fishing; soaking feet in herbal medicine... eating traditional dishes; playing traditional folk games (stick pushing, con throwing, archery, tug of war, sack jumping...)|||'Quang La Flower Paradise' was built on the idea of 'A harmony between nature and life'. Where agricultural production activities, value-added agricultural product processing activities will become a tourism product, a place where visitors can experience and immerse themselves in nature.|||In addition, the 'Quang La Flower Paradise' tourist site is also adjacent to Bang Ca commune, which has the Dao Thanh Y Bang Ca cultural heritage preservation area. The Dao Thanh Y people there still preserve the valuable traditional cultural capital such as: village festivals, Sắc Ceremony; embroidery and traditional costume making; folk medicine; folk songs and dances...); there is a folk club operating regularly, effectively with many folk artists who are knowledgeable about traditional culture.

title: Thanh Y Dao Ethnic Cultural Conservation Village
description: The Thanh Y Dao Ethnic Cultural Conservation Village is a unique cultural preservation project in Quang Ninh Province, invested by the Department of Culture, Sports, and Tourism.|||The village has a population of 138 households, all of whom are Dao Thanh Y ethnic people. The villagers have preserved their traditional cultural heritage, including festivals, rituals, and intangible cultural values such as embroidery, traditional medicine, culinary arts, and folk music and dance. The village also has a folk club with many skilled artisans, including four who have been recognized as Vietnamese Folk Artisans.|||The village is home to many traditional Dao Thanh Y dishes, such as five-color sticky rice, khe snails, khe fish, ginger-cooked chicken, and Bau wine. Many farms in the area grow organic fruit trees and raise wild animals like porcupines, wild boars, and local chickens. The village is also located in the center of the traditional Bau wine production area, a unique drink of the Dao Thanh Y people.|||During the two resistance wars against the French and American colonizers, Bang Ca Commune was an important resistance base, and in 2008, it was recognized as a provincial historical relic.|||The Thanh Y Dao Ethnic Cultural Conservation Village project has been invested with over 15 billion VND, featuring a community house, two model houses of the Dao Thanh Y people, a festival ground, and a 7-room exhibition house showcasing traditional culture, adjacent to the historical site of the resistance base against the French.

title: Man Mountain Scenic Complex
description: Man Mountain, historically known as 'Bân Sơn' meaning harmony and perfection, is a stunning natural wonder. The name 'Bân' signifies a beautiful and complete mountain, both inside and out, with the Mân River flowing through it, earning it the local name 'Mân' or 'Mằn' due to a pronunciation variation.|||The Man Mountain scenic complex is steeped in thousands of years of history and legend, reflecting the deep cultural and spiritual life of the local people through stories like the giant who shouldered rocks to mend the sky, the sacred Bạch Thạch temple, the origins of the quýt lú garden, the story of the mountain with a mouth, and the tales of Ông Cộc, Ông Loang, and Ông Dài. Notably, Man Mountain was a crucial military location in the feudal era, serving as a signal reception and transmission point from Bài Thơ Mountain and Xích Thổ (Nhà Mạc) Citadel for offensive and defensive strategies, especially during the Trịnh-Mạc conflict in the northeastern region.|||Man Mountain is situated between two streams, the Đá Trắng (Bạch Thạch Khe) and the Lưỡng Kỳ (Khe Bân), which flow into the Đá Trắng River, creating a breathtaking landscape with lush vegetation and a unique harmony of mountain and water. This is also the most beautiful limestone mountain, uniquely preserved in the Cửa Lục Gulf area, part of the Ha Long Bay World Heritage site.|||Man Mountain exemplifies the limestone mountain system of Hoành Bồ District, standing over 400m above sea level with steep cliffs, treacherous gorges, and a varied landscape of square, round, smooth, and pointed formations, resembling a kneeling elephant with its trunk bowed towards the Khe Bân stream.|||At the foot of Man Mountain, the Bạch Thạch Temple was built by locals to worship various deities, including Cao Sơn Thượng Đẳng thần, Quý Minh Thượng Đẳng thần, Đại Càn Quốc gia Nam hải, and Đệ nhị Long Vương thượng đẳng thần. In addition to the deities worshiped at Bạch Thạch Temple, Hoành Bồ District is home to a system of temples and shrines related to Man Mountain and Bạch Thạch Temple, scattered across Thống Nhất Commune, Đồng Lâm Commune, and Trới Town, including the shrines of Ông Cộc, Ông Loang, Ông Dài, Thánh Mẫu Shrine, and Xích Thổ Temple. These shrines are closely linked to Bạch Thạch Temple and Man Mountain through captivating legends and divine stories, leaving behind three shrines that worship the three sons of the Man Mountain deity (Ông Cộc, Ông Loang, Ông Dài).|||The shrines of Ông Cộc (Trới Town, Zone 9), Ông Loang (Cài Village, Đồng Lâm Commune), and Ông Dài are located at the confluence of the Bạch Thạch and Bân streams before they flow into the Cửa Lục River.|||Beyond its natural beauty, Man Mountain holds significant cultural and spiritual value. It is connected to the legend of 'The Giant Who Shouldered Rocks to Mend the Sky'.
